result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $74.05 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $7.41 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William R. James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution to Stone Ridge Piggly Wiggly - Ck No 011009

Case called @ 2:14 p.m. Defendant William R. James in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by the DE. Court orders: Restitution in the amount of $74.05, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

Pre-trial conference at 12-09-2015 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-04-2016 02:15 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant William R. James in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and requests to speak with the State on resolution.   NGP entered by Court.   PTC & P/S  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
